TopicTitle: Do ANY females/girl gamers play KSP?

Articles.Content:
Yes, it is another one of "those" post... I was just on another thread that was talking about KSP's impact in the world and in real life space travel and that got me thinking... is there ANY women out there that play Kerbal Space Program?

Seriously, if there is ever a more male-dominated video game in the world, this got to be it. Other games you come across or hear from females even on the forums. I don't think in all my time playing this game have I ever seen a women post on these forums. Unless their username wasn't conspicuous. None on YouTube, none on Twitch, none on Reddit, none on here. There are female scientist and astronauts out there. I am curious who is enthusiastic about this game of the opposite gender.

So without ado... are you a girl gamer who plays KSP? (cricket_soundeffect.wav)

Honestly. I bet there are female players (or do you prefer them fresh and underage asking for girl players?). Not as many as male players, but they are out there. But as far as I know them, they don't like to expose themselves openly. Would you open or answer a thread with something like: "Yes, I am male." ? I think not. Why should they? Sounds like sexism to me actually.

None on YouTube, none on Twitch (...)

You do know Tanuki Chau, right? Prolific KSP streamer, part of KSP TV, worked with Squad to paint all the new biomes in .90...?

There absolutely are girls and women who love and play KSP, I assure you!
There should be an option for 'I'm not, but I know some who do'. I personally know two females who indulge, and I'm not exactly Mr. Social Media.

I identify as an attack helicopter.

There should be an option for warfarekins in the poll.

I identify as an attack helicopter.

There should be an option for warfarekins in the poll.

Oh God. You're not going to start ranting about fixed-wing prejudice are you? Jet fighters have rights too!
I'm more of a space potato. But there's no option for space potatoes....

Adding female kerbals is not only to 'appease' female players, I think it will also encourage a lot of them to sign up and start playing.

As for me, I'm just a lowly astrophysicist of doom...

Precisely. Beginning with that premise tends to create the impression that they will be subject to scrutiny if they step forward. Sure, you might get a few of the bolder ones to step up, but for the most part you'll almost certainly find that they will prefer to avoid the spotlight.

Operating under the assumption that there are none and requesting proof that they are present tends to create an unfriendly atmosphere around the whole issue.
